headline: FirstEnergy (FE): Assessing Valuation After Recent Steady Share Price Gains
summary: FirstEnergy (FE) shares have seen steady gains over the past 3 months, up about 7%, with momentum continuing into this week. The company's year-to-date return sits at roughly 16%, which outpaces broader utility sector trends. See our latest analysis for FirstEnergy. FirstEnergy’s share price has steadily climbed this year, gaining positive momentum and recently closing at $46.22. That puts its 12-month total shareholder return at over 15 percent and signals that investors remain optimistic...

headline: American Water Works Q3 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Up Y/Y
summary: AWK posts strong Q3 results with higher revenues on the back of upbeat rate and announces merger agreement with Essential Utilities.

headline: Xcel Energy Q3 Earnings and Sales Lag Estimates, 2026 EPS Initiated
summary: XEL's third-quarter earnings miss estimates despite higher segment revenues, as costs and interest expenses weigh on results.

headline: Is FirstEnergy Stock a Bargain After 3% Weekly Drop Amid Utility Reform News?
summary: Curious if FirstEnergy is a bargain, pricey, or somewhere in between? Let’s break down what the numbers and recent trends could mean for your portfolio decisions. FirstEnergy’s stock has climbed 14.8% year-to-date and 13.2% over the past year. In the past week, however, it dipped by 3.2% after showing some stability in the last month. Investors have been responding to sector-wide news around utility reforms and new infrastructure investments, which is driving both optimism and caution...
